channel.title: RSCD Based Npc Scripting Application
channel.description:
Here's a new project that I started a few days ago for generating Npc Handlers. The overall goal of this application was to create a way for people with no programming experience to make rudimentary Npc handling routines.
[url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mh3uLfI4UqY]View Demo Here[/url]
To Do: *Fill the toolbox with more logical controls, and code insertion controls *Write methods for storing / loading scripts onto the HD *Include java syntax checking on the custom code module *Advanced input validation (is the user using key words?) *Java syntax highlighting (custom code module) *Complete the script testing environment *Make a professional UI instead of the 'diagnostic' view it's in now.
There's a chance that when I retire from the scene, I'll release a tool-pack containing the various projects that I've made in the past few months.
Any suggestions for toolbox entries are welcomed.
Regards

item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“My epic name, post:26, topic:329094”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=425479.msg3131624#msg3131624 date=1266552016]

[quote author=My epic name link=topic=425479.msg3131150#msg3131150 date=1266517394]

[quote author=xEnt link=topic=425479.msg3131024#msg3131024 date=1266501969]
just as i expected, skipping what i asked. don’t open your mouth and talk like you know something about something when you don’t.
[/quote]No not skipping, if you want to see if i guess you got to wait like everyone else? how about you do it then? easyest thing ever lad your just one of these types of people OMFG IF I CAN DO IT NO ONE CAN! you are actually preety much hated by the people i talk to, you brag to much you think if you can not do it no one can. you failed at a 3D landscape editor that what makes me lol. go back in your hole and wait
[/quote]failing at a 3d landscape editor is better than releasing someone elses and trying to take all the credits for it. I never said i could do what im telling you to do because it’s not possible. On a single thread having that callback is about the easiest you can get a delay, your talking like its easier, show me? stop trying to talk your way out of it and show results, don’t post again unless your going to show me a result.
[/quote]Hah this is funny man, you think its impossible? who said i was using a single thread btw? i think you got yourself mistaken yet again, and ill actually post if i want to post anywere? and did you no who cellky one good one (y) ask some people who no me ;)[/quote]
i was talking about using the same thread, you seem to think you can provide an alternative on the same thread thats much easier.

looking over the RSCD how they handle npc talking and such with delays or how yours are doing it, its just retarded.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Based Npc Scripting Application
item.dc:creator: @My_epic_name My epic name
item.description:
@My_epic_name wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:20, topic:329094”][quote author=My epic name link=topic=425479.msg3130248#msg3130248 date=1266419774]

[quote]Tbh, looking over the RSCD how they handle npc talking and such with delays or how yours are doing it, its just retarded.

final String[] messages11 = {"We will look after your items and money for you", "So leave your valuables with us if you want to keep them safe"}; Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages11) { public void finished() { owner.setBusy(false); npc.unblock(); } });

Its mind fucking me why they did it like that…

RSCD is single threaded, you can’t make it much easier than that using the same thread.
[/quote]It can be made user friendly, stop pointing useless shit out what we no, gosh gtfo u aussie bugger.
[/quote]
come on genius, show me how much easier/user friendly it can get. This is your chance to impress me and gain some respect as this is a worthy question, instead of you gaining epeen by pasting code snippets or screenshots all over this board, especially with your reputation of copy/pasting/photoshopping.[/quote]None of my shit is actually photoshopped, you can ask mapu and some other kiddies, everything what i do gets realsed to people i no. its a shame i don’t think gaining respect from you is on my top TODO list. and yes i have made it more user friendly when i was actually bored. gosh heres the thing xEnt no one needs to gain respect of anyone just because you say so, you and rsc private servers are actually nothing to me its funny that you think it does

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Based Npc Scripting Application
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

KO9 if it was just and others who knew how to script that would be perfect, I agree, but I went through an old RSCA thread where xEnt released the scripting language and not a single person managed to make a script that didn’t need xEnt to go through it and edit it (etc).

Thats mainly because no one in the community cared to try. Rsca scripting is fine, although I would prefer the use of String arrays(which can still be implemented if you chose too, just as easily as using it the way it was meant to be used).

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Based Npc Scripting Application
item.dc:creator: @My_epic_name My epic name
item.description:
@My_epic_name wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:13, topic:329094”][quote author=Kryptix link=topic=425479.msg3127703#msg3127703 date=1266165558]

Would’ve been easier to rewrite NPCHandlers imo, but gj.

We intend on doing every quest, even RSCA members struggled with xEnt’s simple scripting language so Zilent wanted to make it literally fool proof. I was nagging him to make a scripting engine for ages but this opens up more doors tbh. If the application allows you to do something then it will compile and work as intended (that’s the plan anyway). We want to be able to hand the application out and just let 'em go wild. As long as it’s all the talking done we can just do the rest manual (as there’s no point in making the NPCScripter do it if it’s only a one-off quest situation for example).

I agree it’s overkill if we were just using for a select few NPC’s but we want to use it to completely replicate every quest (or at least a large chunk of them) and this will make it a lot easier.

I logged into RSC and decided to replicate the bankers 100% and came up with this in under 30 seconds (no exaggeration what-so-ever):

[code]/**

  • Generated By NPCScript :: A scripting engine created for RSCEmulation by Zilent
    **/
    package server.npchandler;

import server.Server;
import server.event.SingleEvent;
import server.model.Npc;
import server.model.ChatMessage;
import server.model.MenuHandler;
import server.event.DelayedQuestChat;
import server.model.Player;
import server.npchandler.NpcHandler;

public class Banker implements NpcHandler {
public void handleNpc(final Npc npc, final Player owner) throws Exception {
npc.blockedBy(owner);
owner.setBusy(true);
final String[] messages8 = {“Good day, how may I help you?”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages8, true) {
public void finished() {
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new SingleEvent(owner, 1500) {
public void action() {
final String[] options9 = {“I’d like to access my bank account please”, “What is this place?”};
owner.setBusy(false);
owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options9);
owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options9) {
public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
owner.setBusy(true);
for(Player informee : owner.getViewArea().getPlayersInView()) {
informee.informOfChatMessage(new ChatMessage(owner, reply, npc));
}
switch(option) {
case 0:
final String[] messages9 = {"Certainly " + (owner.isMale() ? “sir” : “miss”)};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages9) {
public void finished() {
owner.setBusy(false);
npc.unblock();
owner.setAccessingBank(true);
owner.getActionSender().showBank();
}
});
break;
case 1:
final String[] messages10 = {“This is a branch of the bank of Runescape”, “We have braches in many towns”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages10) {
public void finished() {
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new SingleEvent(owner, 1500) {
public void action() {
final String[] options10 = {“And what do you do?”, “Didn’t you used to be called the bank of Varrock”};
owner.setBusy(false);
owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options10);
owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options10) {
public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
owner.setBusy(true);
for(Player informee : owner.getViewArea().getPlayersInView()) {
informee.informOfChatMessage(new ChatMessage(owner, reply, npc));
}
switch(option) {
case 0:
final String[] messages11 = {“We will look after your items and money for you”, “So leave your valuables with us if you want to keep them safe”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages11) {
public void finished() {
owner.setBusy(false);
npc.unblock();
}
});
break;
case 1:
final String[] messages12 = {“Yes we did, but people kept coming into our branches outside of varrock”, “And telling us our signs were wrong”, “As if we didn’t know what town we were in or something!”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages12) {
public void finished() {
owner.setBusy(false);
npc.unblock();
}
});
break;
}
}
});
}
});
}
});
break;
}
}
});
}
});
}
});
}
}[/code]

Writing the above, worrying about syntax and shit used to take me fucking hours. I hate NPC handlers.
[/quote]
That is quite nice, but here is the same thing using RSCA’s (xEnt’s) NPC handler:

option = PickOption("I'd like to access my bank account please", "What is this place?");
	switch(option) {
		case 1:
			NpcTalk("Certainly " + (owner.isMale() ? "sir" : "miss"));
			player.setAccessingBank(true);
			player.getActionSender().showBank();
			break;
		case 2:
			NpcTalk("This is a branch of the bank of Runescape");
			NpcTalk("We have braches in many towns");
			option2 = PickOption("And what do you do?", "Didn't you used to be called the bank of Varrock")
			switch(option2) {
				case 0:
					NpcTalk("We will look after your items and money for you");
					NpcTalk("So leave your valuables with us if you want to keep them safe");
					break;
				case 1:
					NpcTalk("Yes we did, but people kept coming into our branches outside of varrock");
					NpcTalk("And telling us our signs were wrong");
					NpcTalk("As if we didn't know what town we were in or something!");
			}
	}

This is the entire code. I realise you make it easier with a GUI, but doing that also limits what people can actually do with NPCs and makes it harder for you to edit the code to make it do what you want.[/quote]Tbh, looking over the RSCD how they handle npc talking and such with delays or how yours are doing it, its just retarded.

final String[] messages11 = {"We will look after your items and money for you", "So leave your valuables with us if you want to keep them safe"}; Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages11) { public void finished() { owner.setBusy(false); npc.unblock(); } });

Its mind fucking me why they did it like that…

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Based Npc Scripting Application
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Kryptix, post:3, topic:329096”][quote author=Peeter link=topic=425479.msg3127426#msg3127426 date=1266140791]
Would’ve been easier to rewrite NPCHandlers imo, but gj.
[/quote]
We intend on doing every quest, even RSCA members struggled with xEnt’s simple scripting language so Zilent wanted to make it literally fool proof. I was nagging him to make a scripting engine for ages but this opens up more doors tbh. If the application allows you to do something then it will compile and work as intended (that’s the plan anyway). We want to be able to hand the application out and just let 'em go wild. As long as it’s all the talking done we can just do the rest manual (as there’s no point in making the NPCScripter do it if it’s only a one-off quest situation for example).

I agree it’s overkill if we were just using for a select few NPC’s but we want to use it to completely replicate every quest (or at least a large chunk of them) and this will make it a lot easier.

I logged into RSC and decided to replicate the bankers 100% and came up with this in under 30 seconds (no exaggeration what-so-ever):

[code]/**

  • Generated By NPCScript :: A scripting engine created for RSCEmulation by Zilent
    **/
    package server.npchandler;

import server.Server;
import server.event.SingleEvent;
import server.model.Npc;
import server.model.ChatMessage;
import server.model.MenuHandler;
import server.event.DelayedQuestChat;
import server.model.Player;
import server.npchandler.NpcHandler;

public class Banker implements NpcHandler {
public void handleNpc(final Npc npc, final Player owner) throws Exception {
npc.blockedBy(owner);
owner.setBusy(true);
final String[] messages8 = {“Good day, how may I help you?”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages8, true) {
public void finished() {
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new SingleEvent(owner, 1500) {
public void action() {
final String[] options9 = {“I’d like to access my bank account please”, “What is this place?”};
owner.setBusy(false);
owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options9);
owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options9) {
public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
owner.setBusy(true);
for(Player informee : owner.getViewArea().getPlayersInView()) {
informee.informOfChatMessage(new ChatMessage(owner, reply, npc));
}
switch(option) {
case 0:
final String[] messages9 = {"Certainly " + (owner.isMale() ? “sir” : “miss”)};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages9) {
public void finished() {
owner.setBusy(false);
npc.unblock();
owner.setAccessingBank(true);
owner.getActionSender().showBank();
}
});
break;
case 1:
final String[] messages10 = {“This is a branch of the bank of Runescape”, “We have braches in many towns”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages10) {
public void finished() {
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new SingleEvent(owner, 1500) {
public void action() {
final String[] options10 = {“And what do you do?”, “Didn’t you used to be called the bank of Varrock”};
owner.setBusy(false);
owner.getActionSender().sendMenu(options10);
owner.setMenuHandler(new MenuHandler(options10) {
public void handleReply(final int option, final String reply) {
owner.setBusy(true);
for(Player informee : owner.getViewArea().getPlayersInView()) {
informee.informOfChatMessage(new ChatMessage(owner, reply, npc));
}
switch(option) {
case 0:
final String[] messages11 = {“We will look after your items and money for you”, “So leave your valuables with us if you want to keep them safe”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages11) {
public void finished() {
owner.setBusy(false);
npc.unblock();
}
});
break;
case 1:
final String[] messages12 = {“Yes we did, but people kept coming into our branches outside of varrock”, “And telling us our signs were wrong”, “As if we didn’t know what town we were in or something!”};
Server.requestWorldAccess().getDelayedEventHandler().add(new DelayedQuestChat(npc, owner, messages12) {
public void finished() {
owner.setBusy(false);
npc.unblock();
}
});
break;
}
}
});
}
});
}
});
break;
}
}
});
}
});
}
});
}
}[/code]

Writing the above, worrying about syntax and shit used to take me fucking hours. I hate NPC handlers.[/quote]
That is quite nice, but here is the same thing using RSCA’s (xEnt’s) NPC handler:

option = PickOption("I'd like to access my bank account please", "What is this place?");
	switch(option) {
		case 1:
			NpcTalk("Certainly " + (owner.isMale() ? "sir" : "miss"));
			player.setAccessingBank(true);
			player.getActionSender().showBank();
			break;
		case 2:
			NpcTalk("This is a branch of the bank of Runescape");
			NpcTalk("We have braches in many towns");
			option2 = PickOption("And what do you do?", "Didn't you used to be called the bank of Varrock")
			switch(option2) {
				case 0:
					NpcTalk("We will look after your items and money for you");
					NpcTalk("So leave your valuables with us if you want to keep them safe");
					break;
				case 1:
					NpcTalk("Yes we did, but people kept coming into our branches outside of varrock");
					NpcTalk("And telling us our signs were wrong");
					NpcTalk("As if we didn't know what town we were in or something!");
			}
	}

This is the entire code. I realise you make it easier with a GUI, but doing that also limits what people can actually do with NPCs and makes it harder for you to edit the code to make it do what you want.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCD Based Npc Scripting Application
item.dc:creator: @xx_c1ph3r_xx xx c1ph3r xx
